intro: Argostemma craibianum, commonly known as the white argostemma, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of India and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often hairy, while the fruits are small, dry capsules that contain several seeds. Argostemma craibianum is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
